text: Dean Henry Detton (June 27, 1908 – February 23, 1958) was an American professional wrestler and World Heavyweight Champion who was active in the early portion of the twentieth century. Previously he was a proficient University of Utah football player. Detton was born in Richmond, Utah and raised Mormon. He retired from wrestling in 1951 and then ran a bar, The Turf Club, where he eventually hanged himself to death. For his last 14 years he had lived in Hayward, California.http://nzwrestling.com/clipping/287/Dean+Detton+in+Australia.htmhttp://wrestlingdata.com/index.php?befehl=bios&wrestler;=8008&bild;=1http://mountainviewpeople.blogspot.com.au/2011/01/dean- henry- detton-1908-1958-football.htmlhttps://classicwrestlingarticles.wordpress.com/tag/dean- detton/http://www.oocities.org/wrestlingscout/Legends/Detton.htmlhttp://boxrec.com/list_bouts.php?human_id=424725&cat;=boxerhttps://www.nytimes.com/1936/12/15/archives/detton- pins-dean-with-a-body-press-title-claimant-conquers-giant.html ==Championships and accomplishments== * California State Athletic Commission **California State Athletic Commission World Heavyweight Championship (1 time) * New York State Athletic Commission **New York State Athletic Commission World Heavyweight Championship (1 time)http://www.wrestling- titles.com/us/ny/nysac-h.html **World Heavyweight Championship (1 time)http://www.wrestling-titles.com/world/world-h.html **NWA New Zealand Heavyweight Championship **NWA Hawaii Heavyweight Championship ==See also== * List of premature professional wrestling deaths ==References== Category:1908 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Hayward, California Category:American male professional wrestlers Category:Professional wrestlers from Utah Category:People from Richmond, Utah
